whatIs.title: What is a Headless PoC?
whatIs.body1: It’s a concrete test of your site or application in headless mode, built on a real portion of your domain (e.g. product landing, category page, customer area). We work on top of the existing stack: no full replatforming, no big bang.
whatIs.body2: The goal is to let business, design and IT see and touch performance, UX and integrations with current systems.
whatIs.pillMarketingBody: Validate a new UX on part of the site before investing in a full redesign.
whatIs.pillItBody: Test a headless stack, BFF and integrations without touching the whole monolith.
whatIs.whenItem1: You want to modernise the front-end but a full replatforming is too risky or expensive.
whatIs.whenItem2: You need to convince internal stakeholders with something concrete, not only slides and documents.
whatIs.whenItem3: You want a reusable foundation as a first step towards the new architecture.

timeline.title: How it works: PoC in 5 days
timeline.subtitle: A lean process designed to minimise the time required from your team and maximise the value of the demo.
timeline.note: Timings refer to a standard PoC; we adapt scope to your context.

1.title: Kickoff & scope
1.body: Align on goals, select the page or feature to bring to headless, define the minimum integrations.

2.title: Design & UX
2.body: UI proposal based on your existing brand, with optimisations for conversion and performance.

3.title: Build & integrations
3.body: Next.js development, connection to API / BFF / headless CMS, tracking and Core Web Vitals setup.

4.title: Demo & next steps
4.body: Guided demo, feedback collection, discussion on roll-out and potential go-live.

architecture.title: A modern architecture, on top of the existing one
architecture.body: We use a BFF (Backend For Frontend) approach and/or a headless CMS to connect the new front-end to your current stack, keeping the PoC isolated but ready to grow.
architecture.boxNewFrontendBody: Next.js / React, UI optimised for Core Web Vitals, modern routing, analytics integration.
architecture.boxCmsBody: Content, copy, images and configuration management for the PoC.
architecture.boxLegacyBody: Monolith, e-commerce, CRM, ERP, internal services. The PoC talks to them via APIs or proxy.
architecture.afterPocBody: The PoC is not a throwaway prototype: it can be the first piece of the new architecture, extended to more pages or flows.
architecture.afterPocItem1: Can be promoted to production with a few adjustments.
architecture.afterPocItem2: Gradual roadmap: from PoC to continuous roll-out.
architecture.afterPocItem3: Technical documentation for your team or partner.

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.q1: Could this break something on the current site?
faq.a1: No: we pick an isolated portion (e.g. subdomain or dedicated path) and integrate in read-only mode with your systems. No risky deploys on the monolith.
faq.q2: How much does our team need to be involved?
faq.a2: We structure the PoC to require as little time as possible: typically one joint kickoff and a few technical checks for access and APIs.
faq.a3: Yes, if we agree on this from the start: we already build with production-grade quality so you can decide to promote it with minimal changes.
faq.q4: Can we reuse your best practices internally?
faq.a4: Absolutely: we can do a full handover to your team or keep supporting you as a technical partner.

case.label: Case study
case.title: Local dental clinic
case.meta: Local site, traffic from Meta campaigns and organic search
case.problem: The clinic had an old PHP site, hard to use on mobile and without any tracking. Campaigns generated clicks but it was unclear how many real enquiries came from digital.
case.solution: We designed a new landing focused on core services, with a clear contact form, strong call-to-actions for phone and WhatsApp, and a simple shared spreadsheet to track every enquiry.
results: +65% form enquiries compared to the previous period
40% of enquiries coming from mobile devices
Average time on the main page increased from 25s to 1m05s
The clinic started planning campaigns based on real data

case.label: Case study
case.title: Mid-size furniture e-commerce
case.meta: 1,500 SKUs, legacy monolithic stack, strong mobile traffic
case.problem: Category pages had high LCP and unstable layout. The marketing team was blocked by long development cycles and the board didn’t want to approve a full replatform.
case.solution: We built a headless PoC only on the main category, keeping backend and business logic as they were. We compared user behaviour between the legacy category and the new headless one.
results: LCP reduced from 3.2s to 1.1s on mobile
+14% conversion rate on the tested category

process.title: How the 5-day PoC works
process.subtitle: A highly focused path to get real numbers in a very short time.

steps.title: Scoping
steps.description: We define the section to test, the KPIs and technical constraints based on your current stack.

steps.title: PoC implementation
steps.description: We build the headless frontend, integrate with your APIs and set up tracking and measurements.

steps.title: Test & decision
steps.description: We gather data, compare it with the existing version and propose a migration roadmap.

items.q: Can the PoC go into production?
items.a: Often yes. The code is designed to be the base for a gradual rollout. We’ll assess together what’s needed to make it production-ready.

items.q: Do we have to change the backend as well?
items.a: No. The PoC works on your existing APIs. Backend evolution can happen later if and when it creates clear value.

items.q: How much does it involve our team?
items.a: We keep the load low: we mainly need alignment at the beginning and access to systems/APIs.

cta.title: Want real numbers before migrating?
cta.subtitle: We can design a PoC on a single category or feature and measure the impact before you decide.

deliverables: Process analysis and modelling of the main flows

case.label: Case study
case.title: Orders portal for a B2B food company
case.meta: Network of wholesalers and field agents nationwide
case.problem: Orders were managed via phone, email and messages, with price lists in Excel and no central visibility on what was being sold. Many transcription errors and long times to finalise an order.
case.solution: We designed a B2B portal where agents and clients can access personalised price lists, place orders and track delivery status. An API layer talks to the existing ERP.
results: 70% of orders go through the portal
Average time per order reduced by 40%
Better visibility for management across regions and performance

process.title: How we design a custom web app
process.subtitle: We start from real processes and only build what actually adds value.

steps.title: Process workshop
steps.description: We map current flows, stakeholders and pain points to identify where software can create the most value.

steps.title: Clickable prototype
steps.description: We create a UX/UI prototype to validate screens and journeys with real users.

steps.title: Implementation & integration
steps.description: We develop the app, connect it to your systems and run a pilot with a first group of users.

items.q: How hard is it to maintain a custom app over time?
items.a: We design the architecture with maintenance in mind: clear documentation, separation between frontend and backend, and the option to hand over to your internal team or a partner.

items.q: Can we start small and expand later?
items.a: Yes. We often start with a single process or user group, then extend coverage in further releases.

items.q: Do you also handle hosting and observability?
items.a: We can help you choose infrastructure and set up logging/monitoring, or work together with your DevOps team.

cta.title: Do you have a process that deserves a web app?
cta.subtitle: Tell us how you work today: we can sketch an MVP for a custom application and estimate its impact.
